head.title: Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. - Page #27

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #27 of 32 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Umfreville, Edward. Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0030

div.p: from Portage du Rat. This day we had 1 Port. at a Rapid call'd des Dalles.

July 28 Wednesday. Proceeded towards Portage du Rat, which we reached abt 9 a.m. Here I demanded of Raymond our Governail, if he was certain, he knew the rout to Riviere de lac de Pluye, his answer was that he knew very well, indeed he has profess'd several times before that he was entirely Perfect in it. We proceeded by his direction 'till 5 in the Evening, when he declar'd he knew the way no farther. Once more in distress for a Guide, we knew not what to do in a spacious lac full of Islands. Our trusty indian Guide who conducted us to the last Portage is still with us, but has no knowledge of the way. I consulted with Mr St Germaine on this new difficulty, when he gave his advice to proceed, but where! neither he, or any Person in the Canoe, know any thing of the way, & here it is render'd exceeding uncertain, by the multiplicity of islands. If we go on, we certainly miss the Canoe that is sent to meet us, & probably (instead of reaching the River) wander abt the lake from Island to Island destroying our Provisions & loosing so much time that our Observations cannot reach Montreal in this Fall. I gave it as my opinion to return to Portage du Rats, where all the Canoes pass in their Voyages between le Grand Port. & the interior Country, here I proposed to put our Nets immediately in the water for Fish, & try every method to meet with Indians to procure a Guide, in these Sentiments St Germaine afterwards & the men universally coincided, thinking it much better to remain in the certain track at a good fishing place, than wander abt a pathless lake, putting Life & every thing else at Stake. Mons. St Germaine has pass'd this way 3 or 4 time[s] but knows nothing of the way as having a Guide in the Canoe, he made no remarks.

NB. – I continued the Journal from Portage de l'Isle to Port. du Rats, by way of forming a Comparison of the 2 Routs mentd the 22d from Isle des Framboises, the way we took is undoubtedly the best to go to Port. de l'Isle, & the latter is the nighest to lac du Bois lac de Pluye, the Grand Port. &c. the former way falls into River Winnepeg about 4 Leagues above Port. de l'Isle & the latter (our Guide said) has 5 Portages from Isle des Framboises to Portage du Rats, two of which are long.

I hope some indulgence will be given for making so many use of contractions in the foregoing Journal, as it was copied at Port. de l'Isle, & We wished to begin our Journey to the Grand Portage as soon as possible, that they may be easier understood, it may not be amiss to signify that the Courses are all computed by the mile & parts of a mile, the letter m. following a Figure implies mile. S.C. is strong Currt & I. implies island; any other

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
